parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post refers to Dumitrița Gliga, a deputy, and her family, explicitly mentioning her connection to the PSD party.  This directly identifies a political figure participating in elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, targeting a wide audience through the platform's advertising system. The article is published on a news website and shared on a public platform, indicating an intention to reach a broad audience, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While the post presents itself as a news article, the focus on Dumitrița Gliga and her family's alleged connections to the PSD party could be interpreted as an attempt to influence voters' perceptions of the PSD and, by extension, Dumitrița Gliga. The negative portrayal of the family and their alleged actions could sway public opinion against the PSD.  The objective is not explicitly stated, but the content strongly suggests an attempt to influence voters' opinions, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.  Further investigation into the overall reporting of the news outlet would be needed to determine if this is a pattern of biased reporting or a single instance.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Potentially True. The post is presented as a news article from "Ziarul Tricolorul," a news website. However, the highly critical and potentially biased tone raises questions about its objectivity.  The lack of counterpoints or alternative perspectives weakens its journalistic integrity.  The headline and the excerpt suggest a narrative that could be considered biased and intended to influence public opinion rather than simply reporting facts.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it presents information in a manner that suggests a pre-determined narrative, aiming to influence public opinion. The language used is accusatory and lacks neutrality, suggesting an intention beyond simply expressing an opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>912542110533708</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while presented as a news article, exhibits characteristics of electoral propaganda. It directly refers to a parliamentary candidate (Dumitrița Gliga) and her party (PSD), using potentially biased language to portray them negatively. The post's wide reach through paid advertising on Facebook suggests an intention to influence voters' opinions. While the post could be argued as journalism, the lack of objectivity and the potential for influencing the election outcome lean towards classifying it as electoral propaganda.  The timing of the post, after the official campaign period, is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Dumitrița Gliga</name>
    <impact>NEGATIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Ziarul Tricolorul</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Ziarul Tricolorul, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unui articol (ID postare Facebook: 912542110533708) cu conținut tendențios și negativ despre Dumitrița Gliga, deputat și membru PSD,  având ca efect electoral influențarea negativă a opiniei publice față de aceasta și, implicit, față de PSD.  Articolul, deși prezentat ca jurnalistic,  lipsește de obiectivitate și echilibru, utilizând un limbaj acuzator și lipsit de neutralitate,  "Dumitrița Gliga și Familia: Clanul din Mureș și impunerea lui Cristescu", sugerând o intenție clară de a influența votul electoratului.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
